content:
What is the present tense form of the verb "to have" that completes the sentence "I [present tense verb] a new car, but now it's old"? 
[formula] verb "to have" in present tense = have
The present tense form of the verb "to have" that completes the sentence is "have." So the complete sentence would be: "I have a new car, but now it's old."
